alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 1:29AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Kit Carson County through 215 AM MDT... At 127 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Stratton, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. Torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Stratton around 145 AM MDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 412 and 437. Highway 385 between mile markers 186 and 187. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
